title: Triple H drags away Braun Strowman as Tyson Fury announces WWE match
text:
The two man mountains will face off properly at the end of the month (Picture: WWE)

Things got a little heated on stage as former heavyweight world champion Tyson Fury announced he will take on Braun Strowman at a WWE event in Saudi Arabia on October 31.

The pair have clashed twice already, first on Smackdown and then Raw, with a host of security guards and fellow wrestlers required to keep them apart as their feud escalated.

They will now go head-to-head in Riyadh at WWE Crown Jewel and faced off at a press conference on Friday, sharing an awkward exchange as Strowman refused to release Fury’s hand as they shook.

Things got intense when @BraunStrowman and @Tyson_Fury shared the stage after their match at #WWECrownJewel was made official! pic.twitter.com/BkvKZZnXaZ — WWE (@WWE) October 11, 2019

After some weird back slapping and another stare down, Triple H finally came out to calm things down, dragging Strowman away from Fury and off stage.

Speaking about the bout, Fury said: ‘I just want to say how excited I am to be fighting the monster among men Braun Strowman, after seeing him I really know why he’s got that nickname.

‘But me being the undefeated lineal boxing heavyweight champion, I fear no man. I’m undefeated in 30 professional contests and when I go to Saudi Arabia to fight Braun Strowman, I’m still going to be undefeated, because I’m going to knock him out.

‘He talks about how good his hands are, but he’s messing with a guy who’s got the best hands in boxing. He don’t want none of them hands, let me tell you that.’

Fury’s move into wrestling is being overseen by co-promoter Bob Arum, who said: ‘It’s a pleasure to be here today at the announcement of this very, very unique event. You don’t know this, but I go back a long way with WWE.

‘In 1974 I met a then 29-year-old Vincent Kennedy McMahon and together we promoted the Evel Knievel jump over the Snake River Canyon – that was a long time ago!

Strowman was sent away as Fury shadow-boxed on stage (Picture: WWE)

‘Since then, I’m so proud that Vince has built a company, WWE, that is a worldwide brand, the biggest sports and entertainment company in the world, that entertains people all over the world. It’s truly remarkable.

‘And also remarkable is the lineal heavyweight champion Tyson Fury, the Gypsy King. He’s not only a great fighter, but he reminds me of Muhammad Ali and George Foreman. He’s a consummate heavyweight, he entertains in the ring and he is a tremendous personality.

‘He is a real showman and that’s why people love him. They know he fights with his heart on his sleeve and even though he has a big cut over his eye and blood streaming down his face so he can’t really see his opponent, he carries on to victory.’
